attributes.action: Strip Philip Green of his Knighthood following the loss of 11,000 jobs at BHS
attributes.additional_details: Green and his wife Tina were listed as the UK’s 29th richest family in Sunday Times rich list, which estimated their worth as £3.22bn. That total excludes the £280m which researchers suggested Green might have to hand over to the pensions regulator.  When Green bought BHS in May 2000, the group’s fund was in surplus.  All this while minimising his Tax burden to the UK by listing his wife, a Monaco resident, as the owner of these companies.
attributes.background: (www.theguardian.com) Philip Green’s family/stakeholders have been big winners from BHS, taking more than £580m out of BHS to help fund a lavish lifestyle.  While he awaits delivery of his latest toy: a £100m super-yacht, 11,000 people have lost their livelihoods!
